title: (x) geometric sans w/ slanted e and UC ligatures - ITC Avant Garde Gothic w/ Alternates {Lauren}
content:
hey all,

i'm trying to match the font on the right hand portion of the image below.

the slanted e is a must, and the v and the a are also important!

it would appear to be in the bauhaus family, but beyond that, I'm stumped

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [hut\_logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231916/http:/typophile.com/files/hut_logo.gif) | 5.88 KB |
author: schmod

comments.content:
Andrew, welcome to Typophile (I see you're a newly joined member).

This is [Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231916/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=avant+garde) with [Alternates](http://web.archive.org/web/20120203231916/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=EF.101895.0.0) for the 'v' 'e' and 'T'.

Quite a popular stumper, actually. (I think it's the alternates that throw people off.) But once you know it, it's hard to miss!
wow. you guys are amazing. i've been searching all day, and you guys did it in less than 5 minutes!
I'm actually lucky to have hit it first, especially being on at the same time as some of the more prolific IDers (like Yves/'Bald Condensed')!

\> you guys did it in less than 5 minutes!

Yeah, they're slower on Tuesdays.

hhp
